meanings.definition: The act of tearing or pulling apart violently.
meanings.sent1: The evulsions of the paper showed how strong the wind was.
meanings.sent2: The doctor had to perform evulsions to remove the splinter from the patient's finger.
meanings.sent3: The evulsions of the fabric made the tailor's job much harder.
meanings.sent4: The evulsions in the relationship between the two friends were irreparable.
meanings.sent5: The evulsions of the tree roots from the ground were a sight to behold.

meanings.definition: The result of tearing or pulling apart violently.
meanings.sent1: The evulsions left a trail of destruction in their wake.
meanings.sent2: The evulsions of the rope were evidence of the intense struggle.
meanings.sent3: The evulsions of the cake caused quite a mess in the kitchen.
meanings.sent4: The evulsions of the storm uprooted many trees in the area.
meanings.sent5: The evulsions of the fabric revealed a hidden compartment underneath.
